issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

components.name: Runtime
components.description: Generic bucket for uncategorized runtime issues

fields.description:
All Javascript code in Alloy should pass through jslint without errors. The only exceptions to this rile should be builtins or other JS code that is managed by external authors.

h4. exclusion

* non-Appcelerator builtins (i.e, moment.js, backbone.js, etc...)
* generated JS files (i.e., tss.js TSS grammar file)
* jasmine.js from the "test/lib" folder
* apps in the "test/app/testing" folder

h4. other notes

There are a few exceptions that will be handled later in jslint as well. In particular a few of the following "errors" will cause arguably less readability in the code:

* Redefinition of NAME (simply when assigning a module require to a variable)
* Don't make functions within a loop (no anonymous functions with underscore in loops?!)
fields.summary: Alloy code should pass cleanly through jslint

comments.body:
Verified as working with automatic unit test passing.

Closing.
